title: Jos Buttler

coverImage.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

summary: Jos Buttler is an English international cricketer who is currently vice-captain of the England cricket team.

value.label: Joseph Charles Buttler
Invalid Date (age 28)
Taunton, Somerset, England
British
Batsman, wicket-keeper
Buttler was named Young Wisden Schools Cricketer of the Year in 2010.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: Right-handed batsman and wicket-keeper

value.label: Buttler made his first-class debut for Somerset in September 2009 against Lancashire.
Buttler made his international debut as a specialist batsman in 2011

The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

value.label: Buttler played in all five of England's matches in the competition
Buttler played for Mumbai Indians in the 2016 and 2017 IPL seasons

The Mumbai Indians are a franchise cricket team based in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 2008, Mumbai Indians play in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The team is owned by India's biggest conglomerate, Reliance Industries.

value.label: Buttler scored his first ODI hundred against Sri Lanka at Lord's in 2014

image.altText: Buttler scored his first ODI hundred against Sri Lanka at Lord's in 2014

value.label: In 2018, Buttler scored the fastest T20I half-century by an English cricketer, in 22 balls

image.altText: In 2018, Buttler scored the fastest T20I half-century by an English cricketer, in 22 balls

value.label: Buttler hit 12 sixes, the most by any English batsman in an ODI, while batting against West Indies

image.altText: Buttler hit 12 sixes, the most by any English batsman in an ODI, while batting against West Indies

value.label: Buttler is the second batsman in IPL history to achieve five scores of fifty or more in consecutive matches.

image.altText: Buttler is the second batsman in IPL history to achieve five scores of fifty or more in consecutive matches.
